description: TO AMEND THE SENATE BILL TO GRANT TO THE GOVERNOR OF LOUISIANA AND HIS SUCESSORS IN OFFICE TWO TRACTS OF LAND IN THE COUNTY OF POINT COUPEE, BY ELIMINATING THE SECOND SEC- TION WHICH CONVEYS TO THE GOVERNOR ALL THE RIGHTS OF THE UNITED STATES IN A TRACT F LAND IN THE COUNTY OF POINT COUPEE, STATE OF LOUSIANA, BEING THE SAME ON WHICH THE GREAT LEVEE IS SITUATED, IN TRUST FOR THE PEOPLE OF SAID COUNTY FOR THE PURPOSE OF ENABLING THEM TO REPAIR AND KEEP UP THE SAID LEVEE
TO PASS THE SENATE BILL GRANTING TO THE GOVERNOR OF THE STATE OF LOUISIANA FOR THE TIME BEING, AND HIS SUCESSORS IN OFFICE, TWO TRACTS OF LAND IN THE COUNTY POINT COUPEE. (P.164-1)

TO RATIFY THE RESOLUTION (8 STAT. 244, 2/11/1822), PROVIDING THAT THE SENATE ADVISE AND CONSENT TO THE RATIFICATION OF THE TREATY OF PEACE AND AMITY BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND THE BEY AND REGENCY OF ALGIERS, MADE AND CONCLUDED ON DEC. 23, 1816.

TO REFER TO COMMITTEE ON PUBLIC LANDS THE SENATE BILL CON- FIRMING THE TITLE OF THE MARQUIS DEMAISON ROUGE; WITH INSTR- UCTION TO PREPARE AND REPORT A BILL PROVIDING FOR THE AD- JUDICATION OF THIS CLAIM BY THE REGULAR JUDICIAL TRIBUNALS OF THE U. S.  (P.04-1)

TO AGREE TO THE AMENDMENT AS AMENDED, TO THE HOUSE BILL (3 STAT. 651, 3/7/1822), FOR THE APPORTIONMENT OF REPRESENT- ATIVES TO CONGRESS AMONG THE SEVERAL STATES ACCORDING TO THE FOURTH CENSUS; WHICH AMENDMENT PROVIDES THAT THE STATE OF ALABAMA, ALTHOUGH TS RETURNS ARE NOT COMPLETE, SHALL HAVE THREE REPRESENTATIVES, IF IT APPEARS THEY ARE ENTITLED TO SAME ACCORDING TO THEIR POPULATION AND RATIO HEREBY ESTAB- LISHED

TO AGREE TO THE SECOND AMENDMENT TO APPORTIONMENT BILL, WHICH AMENDMENT ELIMINATES 40,000 AND PROVIDES IN LIEU THEREOF 42,000 AS BEING THE NUMBER OF POPULATION NECESSARY TO ENTITLE STATES TO ONE REPRESENTATIVE; ON A DIVISION CAL- LED FOR, THE VOTE BEING O ELIMINATE 40,000

TO AMEND APPORTIONMENT BILL BY ELIMINATING 40,000 AND PRO- VIDES IN LIEU THEROF 42,000 AS BEING THE NUMBER OF POPULA- TION NECESSARY TO ENTITLE STATES TO ONE REPRESENTATIVE; ON A DIVISION CALLED FOR, THE VOTE BEING TO FIX THE RATIO AT 42,000.  (P.220)

TO RECONSIDER PASSAGE OF THE AMENDMENT TO THE APPORTIONMENT BILL, WHICH AMENDMENT PROVIDES THAT 40,000 BE ELIMINATED AS THE NUMBER OF POPULATION NECESSARY TO ENTITLE STATES TO ONE REPRESENTATIVE.  (P.220, 221)
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF APPORTIONMENT BILL.  (P.221)
TO CONSENT TO THE NOMINATION OF WILLIAM B. IRISH AS MARSHAL FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF PENNSYLVANIA.
TO PASS APPORTIONMENT BILL.  (P.223)

TO AMEND THE PROVISION TO GENERAL APPROPRIATION BILL, BY PROHIBITING THE PAYMENT OF SALARY TO ANY PERSON INDEBTED TO THE UNITED STATES, UNTIL SUCH PERSON SHALL HAVE PAID THE TREASURY ALL SUMS FOR WHICH HE MAY BE SO INDEBTED OR HAS GIVEN SECURITY FOR SUCHPAYMENT

TO AMEND GENERAL APPROPRIATION BILL BY INSERTING A PROVISO THAT NOTHING IN THIS SECTION CONTAINED SHALL EXTEND TO BALANCES ARISING SOLELY FROM THE DEPRECIATION OF TREASURY NOTES RECEIVED BY SUCH PERSON TO BE EXPENDED IN THE PUBLIC SERVICE.  (P.402)

TO CONCUR IN THE AMENDMENT AS IN COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE, TO GENERAL APPROPRIATION BILL, WHICH AMENDMENT ADDS THE PROVISO TO THE END OF SECTION 2 "THAT NOTHING IN THIS SECTION CON- TAINED SHALL EXTEND TO BALANCES ARISING SOLELY FROM THE DEPRECIATION OF TRASURY NOTES RECEIVED BY SUCH PERSON TO BE EXPENDED IN THE PUBLIC SERVICE"

TO AMEND GENERAL APPROPRIATION BILL BY STRIKING OUT THE PRO- VISION THAT NO PERSON THAT HAS BEEN IN ARREARS ONE YEAR TO THE UNITED STATES SHALL RECEIVE ANY COMPENSATION UNDER THIS ACT, UNTIL HE ACCOUNTS FOR AND PAYS INTO THE TREASURY ALL SUMS FOR WHICH H MAY BE LIABLE

TO AMEND GENERAL APPROPRIATION BILL BY INSERTING AFTER THE WORDS "IN ARREARS" THE WORDS "AS PRINCIPAL" SO THAT AS AMEN- DED IT WILL READ, "THAT NO MONEY APPROPRIATED BY THIS ACT SHALL BE PAID TO ANY PERSON FOR COMPENSATION WHO HAS BEEN ONE YEAR IN ARREAR AS PRINCIPAL TO THE U

TO AMEND GENERAL APPROPRIATION BILL BY ADDING A PROVISO THAT NO PERSON BE CONSIDERED IN ARREARS, UNDER THIS ACT, IF COV- ERED BY BOND AND UPON SECURING THE ARREARS DUE TO THE TREA- SURY IN A MANNER THE PRESIDENT MAY DIRECT AND APPROVE. (P.406)

TO AMEND GENERAL APPROPRIATION BILL BY ADDING TO EXEMPT FROM THE PROVISIONS OF THIS ACT, THOSE PERSONS WHO STAND IN ARREARS AS THE SURETIES FOR DISBURSING OFFICERS DURING THE LATE WAR, UNLESS WHERE JUDGEMENT HAS BEEN RENDERED AGAINST HIMSELF AS PRINCIPAL  (P.407)
